Definition: In this task, you're given four sentences of a story written in natural language. The story is incomplete and your job is to select an incorrect end sentence from (A) and (B) such that the story sounds incoherent.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Rick grew up in a troubled household. Sentence2: He never found good support in family, and turned to gangs. Sentence3: It wasn't long before Rick got shot in a robbery. Sentence4: The incident caused him to turn a new leaf. 
 (A) He is happy now. (B) He joined a gang.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, the incident turned a new leaf to Rick's life; so, he must be happy now. Also, he was previously in gang, so, this incident cannot make him to join a gang. So, B is incorrect.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Laverne needs to prepare something for her friend's party. Sentence2: She decides to bake a batch of brownies. Sentence3: She chooses a recipe and follows it closely. Sentence4: Laverne tests one of the brownies to make sure it is delicious. 
 (A) The brownies are so delicious Laverne eats two of them. (B) Laverne doesn't go to her friend's party.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in the third sentence, Laverne follows the recipe closely; brownies should be delicious and she should not cancel going to her friend's party. So, B is incorrect.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Sarah had been dreaming of visiting Europe for years. Sentence2: She had finally saved enough for the trip. Sentence3: She landed in Spain and traveled east across the continent. Sentence4: She didn't like how different everything was. 
 (A) Sarah then decided to move to Europe. (B) Sarah decided that she preferred her home over Europe.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, Sarah didn't like that everything was different in Europe; she must have preferred her home over Europe. So, A is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Rick grew up in a troubled household. Sentence2: He never found good support in family, and turned to gangs. Sentence3: It wasn't long before Rick got shot in a robbery. Sentence4: The incident caused him to turn a new leaf. 
 (A) He is happy now. (B) He joined a gang.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, the incident turned a new leaf to Rick's life; so, he must be happy now. However, A is correct answer, not incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Laverne needs to prepare something for her friend's party. Sentence2: She decides to bake a batch of brownies. Sentence3: She chooses a recipe and follows it closely. Sentence4: Laverne tests one of the brownies to make sure it is delicious. 
 (A) The brownies are so delicious Laverne eats two of them. (B) Laverne doesn't go to her friend's party.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in the third sentence, Laverne follows the recipe closely; brownies should be delicious. However, A is correct answer, not incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Sarah had been dreaming of visiting Europe for years. Sentence2: She had finally saved enough for the trip. Sentence3: She landed in Spain and traveled east across the continent. Sentence4: She didn't like how different everything was. 
 (A) Sarah then decided to move to Europe. (B) Sarah decided that she preferred her home over Europe.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, Sarah didn't like that everything was different in Europe; she must have preferred her home over Europe. However, B is correct answer, not incorrect.

Instances.input:
Sentence1: Charlie would eat anything. Sentence2: He was small, even for a chihuahua, but he loved food. Sentence3: His crowning triumph was when he stole a large pizza. Sentence4: Dismayed, his family rushed him a mean person they called Vet. 
 (A) The two then caused more problems. (B) Charlie changed his bad habits.

Sentence1: Hannah was feeling very stiff and inflexible. Sentence2: She decided to enroll in Yoga class to improve her flexibility. Sentence3: She was terrible at Yoga and for months she did not improve. Sentence4: But, she decided to stick with it and keep trying. 
 (A) Hannah became stiffer over time. (B) Hannah eventually succeeded.

Sentence1: Kelly always had the driest hair. Sentence2: She had no clue what to do. Sentence3: Finally she went to the doctor. Sentence4: He prescribed her pills. 
 (A) Kelly finally had hair that wasn't dry. (B) Kelly loves potato chips.

Sentence1: Jill had to attend a dancing class around 8 P.M. Sentence2: He got ready and drove to the meeting place. Sentence3: He was only of the first people to audition. Sentence4: After his performance, the judges were impressed. 
 (A) He awaited a call back, but he never heard from the judges again. (B) He received many awards for his dance performances.

Sentence1: We woke up this morning to light snow falling. Sentence2: We're excited that school is cancelled for the day. Sentence3: Everyone went outside to play in the snow. Sentence4: We built a snowman and used a carrot for the nose. 
 (A) We had a boring day. (B) We found rocks to use for his eyes and mouth.

Sentence1: Jill was surprised when a handsome boy asked her to the college dance. Sentence2: As her roommates got ready, Jill fussed about her hair. Sentence3: Jill's roommates said they could help. Sentence4: Jill finished dressing into her toga-like white gown. 
 (A) Her date arrived and complimented her appearance. (B) Jill and her friends had a fun girls-only night out.

Sentence1: I went to Hawaii in high school. Sentence2: Our entire band class was going. Sentence3: It took 9 hours to fly there. Sentence4: It was a tropical paradise. 
 (A) I decided that I wanted to go to Hawaii more. (B) Hawaii was not a good place to travel to.

Sentence1: Anthony wanted to learn how to speak Spanish. Sentence2: He found an online Spanish course, and he enrolled. Sentence3: Anthony studied hard, and eventually he learned the language. Sentence4: Anthony speaks Spanish fluently now. 
 (A) Anthony became successful because of his linguistic abilities. (B) Anthony could not get the language down properly.
